title: Stroke
summary: Use F.A.S.T. to recognize stroke symptoms. Time is brain - immediate medical treatment can minimize permanent damage.

steps.title: Use F.A.S.T. Test
steps.description: Face: Ask to smile - look for one side drooping. Arms: Ask to raise both arms - does one drift down? Speech: Ask to repeat simple phrase - is it slurred or strange? Time: If any signs, call 911 immediately.

steps.title: Call 911 and Note Time
steps.description: Call 911 immediately. Tell dispatcher you suspect stroke. Note exact time symptoms started - this is crucial for treatment decisions. Some treatments only work within 3-4 hours.

steps.title: Position Safely
steps.description: Help person lie down with head and shoulders slightly raised (about 30 degrees) on pillows. Turn head to side if vomiting. Do not give food, drink, or medication - swallowing may be affected.

steps.title: Monitor and Reassure
steps.description: Stay with person and monitor breathing and consciousness. Keep them calm and still. Loosen tight clothing. If conscious, reassure them help is coming. Note any changes in symptoms.

steps.title: Gather Information
steps.description: Prepare information for paramedics: time symptoms started, medications they take, medical conditions, what they were doing when symptoms began. If unconscious and not breathing, begin CPR.

warnings: Do NOT give aspirin - strokes can be caused by bleeding
Do not let person 'sleep it off' - immediate treatment is critical
Even if symptoms improve, still seek emergency care
whenToSeekHelp: Call 911 immediately for any stroke symptoms
Time is critical - every minute counts
Call 911 even if symptoms seem to improve
preventionTips: Control high blood pressure and diabetes
Exercise regularly and maintain healthy weight
